title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.2 ADO: QUALITY JUSTICE SERVICES

description.narrative: By 2022, the justice for children mechanisms offer timely, quality and comprehensive justice services for all adolescent girls and boys, including the most deprived, and young people have the opportunity to participate in decisions affecting their lives., which contributes to Access To Justice, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, adolescent boys and girls, especially the most deprived, live free from violence, have capability to reach their full potential and contribute to a cohesive and resilient society.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the justice for children mechanisms offer timely, quality and comprehensive justice services for all adolescent girls andboys, including the most deprived, and young people have the opportunity to participate in decisions affecting their lives.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s sustained advocacy contributed to the introduction of important changes to legislation for children and adolescents. Continued support to the Attorney General’s Office meant that 3,944 victims of child abuse had their cases moved through the justice process. Adolescent participation was also a key focus in 2021, and progress was made in designing a framework for adolescent participation for those in the community and in institutions. Child-centered Disaster Risk Reduction was one strategy to foster such participation and 2,584 children were engaged in interventions around disasters and climate change. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:01/02/2022

title.narrative: National normative framework exits to enable diversion of children in conflict with law(52788), Text

target.value: 2022:Yes - the framework is approved and implementation has begun

actual.value: 2021:Multi-sectoral committee established in the Ministry of Justice, which has oversight of issues related to Justice for Children, including the CYPO and diversion.

actual.value: 2021:Score 2 Score 2: Research report is in the final stage of validation
